div.bibl: Illinois Staats-Zeitung, June 28, 1879. THE MARKSMEN'S FESTIVALResults of the Third Day

body.p: Lively attendance prevailed at the Schuetzenpark (Marksmen's Park) in spite of bad weather. Of course, the crowd--in as far as visitors were concerned--was comparatively small, but the out-of-town marksmen, as well as the local contingent, were participating eagerly, and rivalry was keen.
Rifle teams--consisting of six members of each club--were given a special target. Their performances were indeed exciting. The results were as follows:
[Translator's note- Altogether 14 clubs from various parts of the country competed; the New York Club, at the head of the list, attained the highest score, 1156].

The tournament will continue today. The people's target and men's target are
free for the use of all, upon presentation of shooting permission card.
Bowling for prizes, bird shooting, crossbow shooting, and other events will continue as before.
If the weather is more favorable, attendance will probably be greater. Trains leave the station, Clinton and Carroll Streets, at 8:20 A.M. and 10 A.M. Return train arrives at 7:20.
